item.title: A resolution designating the week of May 17 through May 23, 2015, as "National Public Works Week".
A resolution designating the week of May 17 through May 23, 2015, as "National Public Works Week".

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3251; text as passed Senate: CR S3247)

item.name: Introduced in Senate
item.text:
Designates the week of May 17-May 23, 2015, as National Public Works Week.

Recognizes the important contributions of public works professionals to improving U.S. public infrastructure and to the communities they serve.

item.name: Passed Senate without amendment
item.text:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates the week of May 17-May 23, 2015, as National Public Works Week.

Recognizes the important contributions of public works professionals to improving U.S. public infrastructure and to the communities they serve.
Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S3251; text as passed Senate: CR S3247)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S3251; text as passed Senate: CR S3247)

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2998; text as passed Senate: CR S2978)

item.latestTitle: A resolution designating the week of May 15 through May 21, 2016, as "National Public Works Week".

bill.title: A resolution designating the week of May 17 through May 23, 2015, as "National Public Works Week".

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
